pull.title: doc: mention that BDB is for the legacy wallet in build-freebsd.md
pull.body:
Re-order legacy and descriptor wallet section.
Remove prelude that pointlessly repeats the same info.
Cleanup configure examples.

FreeBSD version of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23446.

events.message:
doc: mention that BDB is for the legacy wallet in build-freebsd.md

Re-order legacy and descriptor wallet section.
Remove prelude that pointlessly reqpeats the same info.
Cleanup configure examples.

events.body: Mentioning BDB is for legacy wallets would be beneficial
@shaavan would you like to review this?

ACK b5ba3b5b2cbec4db94037baad960410fe98f3fdd

I like the idea of moving sections talking about descriptor wallets (about adding support and compiling) before legacy wallets because:

1. We want to encourage users to build a descriptor wallet over the legacy wallet. And talking about descriptor wallet first is one way to do so.
2. It maintains consistency with other updated documentation, prioritized for the descriptor wallet over the legacy wallet.

I verified that: 

1. Links for FreeBSD and descriptor wallet direct to the correct webpage and documentation, respectively.
2. The code corresponding to installing db5 and compiling descriptor wallet and GUI (a move-only change) is correct.
